TextAsset.value: (Or anyone else who might be a teenage crime fighter.)
(Then again a cafe seems like a strange place for these guys to meet.)
${slot:playerName}! Welcome to the Namco Anti Real Crime Group. Namco High’s own criminal justice club.
Uh, yeah. Happy to be here!
I wasn’t up to any other capers.
Ha! Taking it easy, then? Well, glad you could make it.
(Al doesn’t waste any time, does he!)
This semester the club is raising awareness of cheat code trafficking.
They’re dangerous weapons, and that’s why they have to be heavily regulated.
But you wouldn’t know anything about cheat codes. Would you, ${slot:playerName}?
(And I’ll cap that off with my OWN wink…)
(Bet it’s the official minutes of the meeting.)
(But shouldn’t the club secretary be doing that?)
This being a criminal justice club, let’s talk about our firsthand experiences with crime.
And, for example, cheat code trafficking.
Because I only see you and me.
No. See. Everyone in this cafe?
Even the baristas and the super elderly couple in the back corner?
And the guy who was begging for change earlier?
Yup, sure. Yes. All of them.
They’re all practicing undercover. Deep cover. Under deep cover.
So, when did you start wall clipping?
(What’s he...how does a wall get clipped?)
Is that different from the wall clip?
But then you have to be in this business, don’t you.
(Man, Al goes from zero to SUPER FLIRTING in like two seconds.)
It’s how I get away with all the ~bad~ stuff I do.
(It’s a little weird that he takes notes while flirting…)
Well, I didn’t wind up in detention by helping old ladies across the street.
(I guess sometimes that’s how flirting goes.)
(Does he mean like a GRADE level?)
(But, wait, that’s like, from being smart, isn’t it? How is that bad?)
(Because skipping ahead can alienate you from both your original peer group as well as the new one you find yourself in.)
(He has such a dangerous loner tough guy persona I never would have suspected it.)
(And that he’d show me his softer side so quickly...gosh!)
Well, that’s just how I roll.
(At least, that’s what Principal Dig-Dug says…)
You help other kids skip levels?
(Uh, how do I do this one all flirty???)
(Hm, I guess so. Al’s taking tons of notes.)
Seems like you’re the beating heart of the underbelly of this town.
(Uh, okay. I guess that one just got away from him!)
(Even a suave guy like Al is gonna have a fumble every now and then.)
(There. Maybe that got the train back on track!)
You think you can stay one step ahead forever, ${slot:playerName}?
(I am so gonna order a coffee when the club meeting is over and feel like a total grown up.)
The thing about cheat codes, ${slot:playerName}, is…
Cheat codes are a deadly business, ${slot:playerName}.
And without rules, there’s only chaos.
They hurt people. There’s no way around that.
If you criminalize cheat codes, then only criminals will have cheat codes.
You’ve got an answer for everything, don’t you.
(Ha! At this rate maybe I’ll make it a latte!)
You won’t get away from me forever.
Maybe I want to get caught.
Oh? And what about until then?
What about the innocent people trapped in the crossfire?
(Hm? Should I have played hard to get there?)
You’re a tough nut to crack, ${slot:playerName}.
(What the heck did I mean by that?!?)
(Hm, walk it off! Do better on the next one.)
Unfortunately, I can’t legally detain you any longer.
